meanings.definition: An extremely strong reaction of anger, shock, or indignation.
meanings.sent1: The news of the unfair treatment sparked an outrage among the community.
meanings.sent2: The public expressed their outrage over the unjust decision.
meanings.sent3: It was an outrage how long the line at the grocery store was!
meanings.sent4: The outrageous behavior of the politician left everyone speechless.
meanings.sent5: The child's tantrum was an outrage to his parents.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel outraged.
meanings.sent1: The misleading advertisement can outrage customers.
meanings.sent2: Her rude comment managed to outrage everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: I didn't mean to outrage you with my joke, I apologize.
meanings.sent4: His actions will outrage the entire community.
meanings.sent5: The unfair treatment will outrage many people.

meanings.definition: A grossly offensive or violent act.
meanings.sent1: The vandalism of the park was an outrage to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The assault on the elderly man was an outrage to society.
meanings.sent3: The outrageous behavior of the bullies was finally addressed by the school.
meanings.sent4: The crime scene was an outrage to the detectives.
meanings.sent5: The destruction of the historical monument was an outrage to the city.
